name: places/ChIJCa2lCJdZwokR1C-idzPq1nk
formattedAddress: 46 W 11th St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 46 W 11th St, New York, NY 10011-9216, USA

originalText.text: Overall very happy with this neighborhood-centric practice, but have been especially grateful for Dr. Agliano’s above and beyond care he provided to our child and by extension our family during a confusing period of illnesses. Yes of course I think many patients would wish for an online portal but most important is that you can always reach a doctor or have a doctor at the practice call you back and fit your child in for a sick visit when needed!

Yes of course I think many patients would wish for an online portal but most important is that you can always reach a doctor or have a doctor at the practice call you back and fit your child in for a sick visit when needed!

originalText.text: Fantastic! I received stellar care here, I was originally recommended to it after a really easy birthing process at NYU Langone and Dr. Lori Rosello and one other doctor here is affiliated with them and they have been stellar with my daughter. The front desk is efficient and they book appointments so you don’t have to wait long I doubt I’ve ever waited more than 5 minutes although it would be worth a longer wait. The office is downstairs but have you seen what nyc commercial rental prices are lately? I would much rather they budget there than have to book a hundred appts to afford the rent. Overall I’ve received really prompt care and test results have been really fast even when my baby had really high bilirubin i was called later that day with results and they followed up on my partners phone bc I didn’t check my phone ( slept all day after the birth). Highly recommend.

originalText.text: The doctors are good but the office is antiquated and charges for you get your own medical records. Even after a conversation with the staff to determine the cost, they led me in the wrong direction for what the least expensive option was and when I called to discuss, they had an arbitrary number in their head for what "expensive" meant to them. They then hung up on me.

originalText.text: The staff at the front desk are very rude. the doctor's are always late even if you schedule the first AM appointment. you spend a lot of time waiting. facilities are very very dated, no digital medical records, frequently the doctor's do not even review the child's chart prior to the visit creating confusions with vaccines. overall just a mess. place looks like it hasn't been properly cleaned in years.

text.text: The staff at the front desk are very rude. the doctor's are always late even if you schedule the first AM appointment. you spend a lot of time waiting. facilities are very very dated, no digital medical records, frequently the doctor's do not even review the child's chart prior to the visit creating confusions with vaccines. overall just a mess. place looks like it hasn't been properly cleaned in years.

originalText.text:
I am extremely disappointed with West 11th Pediatrics due to poor service and disorganized/outdated administration. I'm sure the doctors are completely competent but this was my experience:
1) I brought my 2 day old newborn son and waited over an hour to see a doctor. No one checked in to say what was happening or give us an update. Its only when we walked out of the appt after did a Dr come out.
2) My son ate a new food and broke out in a rash all over his face. Obviously concerned, I called office right away and the administrator paged the doctor. There was no communication follow-up from a doctor or office rep.
3) I called to transfer my son's medical records to a new pediatrician. They charge $30 and it takes a week via a clunky process. (Not that I did this at another pediatrician and they emailed medical records for free within an hour).
